instructions_to_main_agent: DO NOT use generic 'Dashboard' titles. Use specific context like 'Donor Registration Console' or 'Inventory Control Center'.
For Data Tables: Use 'dense' padding. Blood banks deal with thousands of units; whitespace is expensive.
For Forms: Break long forms (Donor Registration) into Steps/Wizard. Do not dump 50 inputs on one page.
Authentication: Implement a role-selector on the login screen to simulate the 8 different personas easily.
Barcode Simulation: Use a font like 'Libre Barcode 39' or generate visual placeholders using CSS patterns for the 'Traceability' module.
Critical Actions: Any 'Discard' or 'Release' action MUST have a confirmation dialog with a red/warning theme.
Theme Toggle: Implement a sun/moon toggle in the sidebar footer.
Use 'sonner' for all toast notifications (Success: Unit Added, Error: Validation Failed).
Charts: Use Recharts. Style them minimally. No 3D pie charts. Use Area charts for trends and Bar charts for inventory counts.
universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) sparingly (only on sticky elements)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable in 'Marketing' areas, but keep 'Data' areas dense.
Subtle grain textures on the sidebar background to separate it from the main content.
